column4: does anyone know if ubuntu-server will install desktops? Or will I have to start over from a desktop version of ubuntu ?
Ubuntu server does not come with a desktop by default
yeah
would xfce (xubuntu) run 'that much better' than Gnome on old hardware?
In my opinion they run the same.
I'm thinking I might as well install Ubuntu since I have the ubuntu disk.
you purge it first then install it.  It won't take care of ~/.files though  those you have to delete manually
they'll have to come up with something when the options are KDE 4, Gnome 3, xfce 5, etc etc
libreOffice is an open source community project.  Openoffice is controlled by oracle
It looks and "Feels" the same to me.
Many distros switched to libreOffice because it is more free
libreOffice is a fork of openOffice.  Originally they were identical.  Now they are nearly identical
sort of like Fedora vs Red Hat ? One is "more free" ?
Except Fedora is still controlled by the red hat corporation
So that's not really a good analogy
they are nearly identical at this point because the fork happend like 2 months ago
Both versions are open source so both versions work on all platforms that have a C compiler (pretty much all compilers)
OK, but any reason to go all Patriotic on Libre and boycot the OpenOffice?
Actually it's even more convoluted now because Oracle recently 'gave' openoffice to the community so now they're both pretty much the same in every way except branding
My advice is to not fix what isn't broke.  Leave openOffice on the machines that have it until you have a problem there
Leave libreOffice on those machines.  They're completely compaitable anyway
I can guess you can switch if you have a problem with anonymous community members vs. anonymous oracle employees
:)  Glad we could help
